citations.narrative:
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Three dogs are
not up to date on their Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations, a required vaccination. The current Program of Veterinary
Care prescribes for these vaccines to be given every 12 months. The following dogs are overdue for the Distemper and
Parvovirus vaccines:
-Adult female Maltese (#494) last received a Distemper and Parvovirus vaccine on 8/25/2023.
-Adult female Miniature Poodle (#413) last received a Distemper and Parvovirus vaccine on 9/28/2023.
-Adult female Miniature Poodle (#473) last received a Distemper and Parvovirus vaccine on 11/30/2023.
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to
Distemper and Parvovirus, which if contracted, can cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by contacting the
Attending Veterinarian to create a plan to determine when to vaccinate these animals. Correct by 11-APRIL-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Three dogs are 
not up to date on their Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations, a required vaccination. The current Program of Veterinary 
Care prescribes for these vaccines to be given every 12 months. The following dogs are overdue for the Distemper and 
Parvovirus vaccines: 
 
-Adult female Maltese (#494) last received a Distemper and Parvovirus vaccine on 8/25/2023. 
-Adult female Miniature Poodle (#413) last received a Distemper and Parvovirus vaccine on 9/28/2023.  
-Adult female Miniature Poodle (#473) last received a Distemper and Parvovirus vaccine on 11/30/2023. 
 
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to 
Distemper and Parvovirus, which if contracted, can cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by contacting the 
Attending Veterinarian to create a plan to determine when to vaccinate these animals. Correct by 11-APRIL-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative. 
 
 n
